Present location: INSTITUT DE PAPYROLOGIE ET D'ÉGYPTOLOGIE, UNIVERSITÉ DE LILLE III [02/049] LILLE
Name: Jar stand
Description: A row of ceramic vessels, among which this jar stand, was found placed along the wall of a rock-cut tomb at Mirgissa/Iken. It is asymmetrical, has a simple flared upper lip and a convex double-beaded lower lip. The clay is coarse, common, buff-coloured and has been polished. The two sides bears bands of white paint.
